<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IPO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/26/robinhoods-roadshow-previews-ipo-unlike?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
An IPO Unlike Any Other
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Robinhood illustration " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTI3L3JvYmluaG9vZF9pbGx1c3RyYXRpb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Robinhood execs gave a livestreamed presentation to the public Saturday, ahead of the company’s much-anticipated IPO later this week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like many aspects of the company’s public offering, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/21/technology/robinhood-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">that isn’t normal</a>. Typically, this investor presentation, known as a “roadshow,” is given behind closed doors to hedge funds and bankers to hype them up ahead of the offering. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Robinhood isn’t just trying to court professional investors, it’s trying to court <em>you</em>, the trader who has a non-finance job but loves to talk stocks in your group chat. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As part of its mission to “democratize investing,” Robinhood plans to sell as much as <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-24/robinhood-ditches-ipo-traditions-again-in-a-roadshow-open-to-all?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">35% of its shares</a>, or $770 million worth, directly to customers on its app. That will allow individual traders to buy stock in the company alongside professionals, and perhaps get ahead of any first-day “pop” in the stock price. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Companies have historically reserved only 1%–2% of shares for customers, because what Robinhood is doing is risky. Here’s why:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>When professional investors buy shares in an IPO, they tend to hold them for a long time. Individual traders could sell the stock immediately. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Robinhood has experienced technical glitches in the past when trading volume is particularly intense. Any snags during its IPO would be disastrous and could potentially lead to lawsuits.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even if the offering does go smoothly, don’t expect a flood of companies trying to replicate this model. As the app that single-handedly revolutionized the world of stock trading, Robinhood has far greater name recognition with the average investor than most companies and is uniquely positioned to take advantage.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">OK, back to the presentation </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Did the investors reveal anything interesting? Actually, yes. Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev said the company was considering offering <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/robinhood-ceo-says-he-is-considering-offering-us-retirement-accounts-2021-07-24/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">retirement accounts</a>, IRAs and Roth IRAs, through the platform. “We want to make first-time investors into long-term investors,” he said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Robinhood will price its IPO on Wednesday night and start trading on Thursday. It’s aiming for a valuation of around $35 billion. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TOBACCO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/26/philip-morris-ceo-wants-unsmoke-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Smoking CEO Wants to “Unsmoke the World”
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/26/philip-morris-ceo-wants-unsmoke-world?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of the planet Earth sitting on top of crumpled cigarettes in a grey ashtray. Smoke fumes are rising off the top of the Earth." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzcwL2NvMi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Jacek Olczak, the CEO of Marlboro maker Philip Morris, told The Mail yesterday that the company will <a href="https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-9822189/Tobacco-giant-Philip-Morris-stop-selling-cigarettes-Britain-ten-years.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stop selling cigarettes</a> in Britain in the next 10 years.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yeah, we did a double take too, but it is not fake news: Olczak is <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/business/2021/jul/25/tobacco-firm-philip-morris-calls-for-ban-on-cigarettes-within-decade?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">urging the British government</a> to treat cigarettes like fossil-fuel cars and basically regulate them to death (the government is banning the sale of gasoline-powered vehicles in 2030). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So how will that work from a business perspective, exactly? </strong>Philip Morris wants to transition to a “healthcare and wellness company” where half of its sales come from non-smoking products.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The company currently generates a quarter of its revenue from alternatives such as its electronic IQOS device that heats tobacco instead of burning it. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Earlier this month, Philip Morris said it would buy Vectura, a company that makes asthma inhalers. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Critics say the public shouldn’t trust cigarette companies to lead a campaign that would ban smoking, especially when they’re still marketing cigarettes in lower income countries where most of the world’s smokers now reside.  </p>

<tr>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ANTITRUST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/26/biden-assembles-antitrust-ateam?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Biden’s A-Team
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A = antitrust</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With last week’s nomination of Jonathan Kanter to lead the DOJ’s antitrust division, President Biden has assembled a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/24/business/biden-antitrust-amazon-google.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">three-headed beast</a> of a team to take on Big Tech’s market dominance. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s look at the players.</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Jonathan Kanter: </strong></span><span>He’s a private lawyer who’s represented companies, like Yelp, that have accused Google of </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-20/biden-to-name-google-foe-jonathan-kanter-as-doj-antitrust-chief?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">abusing its position</a></span><span> to quash rivals. A favorite of progressives, he has criticized the current antitrust framework for years.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Lina Khan: </strong></span><span>The new chair of the Federal Trade Commission is just 32, but she could fill libraries with her writings on antitrust policy. Her 2017 paper, </span><span><a href="https://digitalcommons.law.yale.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=5785&context=ylj" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Amazon’s Antitrust Paradox</a></span><span>, put her on the map as a fresh thinker in the space.   </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Tim Wu: </strong></span><span>The Columbia law professor now serving on the National Economic Council has encouraged the government to break up Facebook. He thinks the Obama administration, which he also worked for, was </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/05/technology/tim-wu-white-house.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">too lenient</a></span><span> in letting some tech mergers slide. </span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Some of these folks have been so vocal with their criticisms of Big Tech that they might be asked to recuse themselves from investigations over conflicts of interest. Facebook and Amazon have asked Khan to step back on any matters involving their companies, while Google could ask the same of Kanter. </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/25/key-performance-indicators-july-26?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/25/key-performance-indicators-july-26?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Photos from the Opening Ceremony" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Q53yLdCf8bmxymyKdy/giphy.gif">

<img class="story-header-image" alt="Photos from the Opening Ceremony" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Q53yLdCf8bmxymyKdy/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Wally Skalij /Los Angeles Times via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The opening ceremony of the Tokyo Olympics drew just <a href="https://www.reuters.com/lifestyle/sports/tokyo-olympics-opening-drew-167-mln-tv-viewers-nbcuniversal-2021-07-24/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">16.7 million viewers</a> in the US, down 37% from Rio 2016 and the smallest audience for the event in 33 years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“I’ve been trying to find some silver linings and I guess one of the good things that I tell myself is that the next Olympics is only three years away now instead of four.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">American beach volleyball player Taylor Crabb described what it felt like to train for years to compete in the Olympics only to be <a href="https://apnews.com/article/2020-tokyo-olympics-lifestyle-sports-health-coronavirus-pandemic-74d54096c680f6ed2c8d052742a54c16?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quarantined</a> in a Tokyo hotel room. Crabb tested positive for Covid-19 when he arrived in Japan on Sunday and can’t leave the country for 10 days.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Can Silicon Valley find God? (<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/07/16/opinion/ai-ethics-religion.html?referringSource=articleShare" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York Times</a>)</p>

</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>More than a third of S&P 500 companies will <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/07/23/earnings-federal-reserve-are-next-big-catalysts-as-stocks-enter-week-ahead-on-an-upswing.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">report</a> their Q2 results this week, including Tesla, Facebook, Amazon, Microsoft, Alphabet, McDonald’s, Starbucks, and Boeing. Q2 earnings are projected to have increased 74% annually, the biggest rise since Q4 2009. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Fed meeting: </strong>The central bank surprised the business world last meeting when it said it would <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/16/fed-boosts-inflation-projections-signals-rate-hike-2023?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hike interest rates by 2023</a>. Will we get some information on its bond-buying program this time around? Tune in Wednesday.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Economic data: </strong>GDP for the second quarter will drop on Thursday. It’s expected to show the US at peak growth—9.7%.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><a href="https://www.nbcolympics.com/schedule?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lots and lots of Olympics</a></span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The NBA Draft is on Thursday. So is Lollapalooza. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Wanna feel old? Harry Potter turns 41 on Saturday.</span></li>
</ul>

</span><span><a href="https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/31878404/bryson-dechambeau-tests-positive-covid-19-not-play-olympics-team-usa?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Olympics rundown</a></span><span>: Golfers Jon Rahm and Bryson DeChambeau tested positive for Covid-19 and are out of the competition. </span><span><a href="https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/team-usa-basketball-vs-france-score-tokyo-olympics-u-s-collapses-late-loses-first-olympic-game-since-2004/live/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">USA men’s basketball</a></span><span> lost to France, its first loss at the Olympics since 2004. </span><span><a href="https://www.espn.com/olympics/story/_/id/31880478/us-women-gymnastics-team-2nd-place-qualifying-first-decade?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Russia</a></span><span> topped the US women’s gymnastics team in qualifying. </span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2021/jul/25/anna-kiesenhofer-claims-shock-road-race-glory-as-van-vleuten-mistakes-silver-for-gold-olympics?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">A math PhD</a></span><span> took gold in a historic cycling upset.</span>

<span>

<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

</span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/07/23/crocs-lawsuits-walmart-hobby-lobby/?itid=sf_business" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Crocs</a></span><span> sued Walmart, Hobby Lobby, and other companies for copying the “iconic design” of its shoes.</span>

<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/armani-bounces-back-pandemic-sales-rise-34-first-half-2021-07-25/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Armani</a></span><span> sales increased 34% in the first half of 2021, but said revenue wouldn’t get back to pre-pandemic levels until next year.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/photos-fires-rage-across-west-e6f70fe8-330a-42dc-9607-82cd0b8d719d.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Dixie Fire</a></span><span>, California's biggest fire and one of 86 major fires burning out west, destroyed dozens of homes in the northern region of the state.</span>

Other\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Robinhood illustration \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRobinhood execs gave a livestreamed presentation to the public Saturday, ahead of the company’s much-anticipated IPO later this week.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike many aspects of the company’s public offering, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/21/technology/robinhood-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethat isn’t normal\u003c/a\u003e. Typically, this investor presentation, known as a “roadshow,” is given behind closed doors to hedge funds and bankers to hype them up ahead of the offering. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Robinhood isn’t just trying to court professional investors, it’s trying to court \u003cem\u003eyou\u003c/em\u003e, the trader who has a non-finance job but loves to talk stocks in your group chat. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs part of its mission to “democratize investing,” Robinhood plans to sell as much as \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-24/robinhood-ditches-ipo-traditions-again-in-a-roadshow-open-to-all?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e35% of its shares\u003c/a\u003e, or $770 million worth, directly to customers on its app. That will allow individual traders to buy stock in the company alongside professionals, and perhaps get ahead of any first-day “pop” in the stock price. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCompanies have historically reserved only 1%–2% of shares for customers, because what Robinhood is doing is risky. Here’s why:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhen professional investors buy shares in an IPO, they tend to hold them for a long time. Individual traders could sell the stock immediately. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRobinhood has experienced technical glitches in the past when trading volume is particularly intense. Any snags during its IPO would be disastrous and could potentially lead to lawsuits.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEven if the offering does go smoothly, don’t expect a flood of companies trying to replicate this model. As the app that single-handedly revolutionized the world of stock trading, Robinhood has far greater name recognition with the average investor than most companies and is uniquely positioned to take advantage.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOK, back to the presentation \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDid the investors reveal anything interesting? Actually, yes. Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev said the company was considering offering \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/robinhood-ceo-says-he-is-considering-offering-us-retirement-accounts-2021-07-24/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eretirement accounts\u003c/a\u003e, IRAs and Roth IRAs, through the platform. “We want to make first-time investors into long-term investors,” he said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eRobinhood will price its IPO on Wednesday night and start trading on Thursday. It’s aiming for a valuation of around $35 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: href=\"https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-9822189/Tobacco-giant-Philip-Morris-stop-selling-cigarettes-Britain-ten-years.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYeah, we did a double take too, but it is not fake news: Olczak is \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/business/2021/jul/25/tobacco-firm-philip-morris-calls-for-ban-on-cigarettes-within-decade?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eurging the British government\u003c/a\u003e to treat cigarettes like fossil-fuel cars and basically regulate them to death (the government is banning the sale of gasoline-powered vehicles in 2030). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo how will that work from a business perspective, exactly? \u003c/strong\u003ePhilip Morris wants to transition to a “healthcare and wellness company” where half of its sales come from non-smoking products.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company currently generates a quarter of its revenue from alternatives such as its electronic IQOS device that heats tobacco instead of burning it. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEarlier this month, Philip Morris said it would buy Vectura, a company that makes asthma inhalers. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBiden’s A-Team\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA = antitrust\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith last week’s nomination of Jonathan Kanter to lead the DOJ’s antitrust division, President Biden has assembled a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/24/business/biden-antitrust-amazon-google.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethree-headed beast\u003c/a\u003e of a team to take on Big Tech’s market dominance. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet’s look at the players.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJonathan Kanter: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHe’s a private lawyer who’s represented companies, like Yelp, that have accused Google of \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-20/biden-to-name-google-foe-jonathan-kanter-as-doj-antitrust-chief?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eabusing its position\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to quash rivals. A favorite of progressives, he has criticized the current antitrust framework for years.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLina Khan: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe new chair of the Federal Trade Commission is just 32, but she could fill libraries with her writings on antitrust policy. Her 2017 paper, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://digitalcommons.law.yale.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=5785\u0026context=ylj\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAmazon’s Antitrust Paradox\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, put her on the map as a fresh thinker in the space.   \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTim Wu: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Columbia law professor now serving on the National Economic Council has encouraged the government to break up Facebook. He thinks the Obama administration, which he also worked for, was \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/05/technology/tim-wu-white-house.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etoo lenient\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in letting some tech mergers slide. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eSome of these folks have been so vocal with their criticisms of Big Tech that they might be asked to recuse themselves from investigations over conflicts of interest. Facebook and Amazon have asked Khan to step back on any matters involving their companies, while Google could ask the same of Kanter. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable
